wikipedia_page.main: Montague Shadworth Seymour Moore VC (9 October 1896 – 12 September 1966) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

link_mentions.page: List of English Victoria Cross recipients
response: |Montague Shadworth Seymour Moore || British Army || 1917 || First World War || Ypres
* 2nd Lieutenant Montague Shadworth Seymour Moore, 15th (Service) Battalion, Hampshire Regiment, Great War
* Montague Shadworth Seymour Moore, recipient of the Victoria Cross, was born in Worthing in 1896.
